We consider the effects of applying the Fourier transform \\( \\mathcal{F} \\) to the initial condition.

If one observes the transformed state \\( u(x, t) \\) at time t, can they infer the original state \\( u_0(x) \\) accurately without knowing the Fourier transform was applied initially?
Explanation: Without the knowledge of the initial application of the Fourier transform, it is impossible to correctly back-calculate to the original form of \\( u_0(x) \\) as the transformed initial condition affects the evolution under the operator L, resulting in a state that does not directly map back to the original \\( u_0(x) \\).
